alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 5:56PM PST until January 09 at 12:19AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. .Heavy rain across the area has ended. The river has crested in major flood stage and will continue to recede through Saturday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 215.0 feet, the Skookumchuck River in Thurston County will cause major flooding in the Bucoda area...with deep and swift flood waters inundating residential and business areas and numerous roads. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters...tributaries...and other streams within and near the Skookumchuck River Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM PST Friday the stage was 215.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM PST Friday was 216.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 206.6 feet Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 211.5 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 400 AM PST.
